p: Segun et al. reported the anti-enteroviral activity of three stilbenoids (mappain, vadelianin and schweinfurthin G; Fig. 17 ) isolated from the leaves of Macaranga barteri (Euphorbiaceae) [ 95]. The pure compounds were tested against echovirus 7, 13 and 19 serotypes and were inactive against echovirus E13, while a good activity was reported on E19. In particular, vadelianin exhibited an IC 50 value of 0.0036 nM and the best selectivity profile with SI value of 216.7 [ 95].
